lines.text: Ratio of force produced to force applied

definitions.def: How much a machine multiplies the force applied to it.  It equals the ratio of force produced by the machine to the force applied to the machine.

secText: Machines are used because they change the direction of a force or supply mechanical advantage.

Mechanical advantage equals the ratio of the force produced to force applied.  Often the desire is to have a ratio greater than one âˆ’ for the machine to produce a greater force than the force that is inputted into the machine.
The equation shows how mechanical advantage is calculated. The ratio has no unit.
